page.title: 05ECOLOGY
page.content: { WOODLAND}This area used to be wooded and over the years this has slowly declined, due to farming and the housing estate at Speke. The remains of the woods are still visible at the Damwoods, Alderwoods and Millwoods at Speke. Big Boar, Little Boars Woods, the ice and old plantations at Hale. {GRASSLAND}The area has general open farmland and the Pasture land has been taken over for grain and root crops and there are no cattle and sheep.{ {HEATH}Some of the heath land still exists, but due to the building and siting, of the Airport runway, Fire Station and ancilliary building has been reduced in area. {MARSH }There is some marsh land which is subject to tidal flow, and part of this leads to the Decoy Marsh, with {Hale Decoy}outside the village of Hale.
